reviews.review_msg: girl lemme tell u wsp. THIS PROF IS AMAZING!! you will do well as long as u put in the work, tests are very very fair. thank u evan.

Good Prof. Will be sad when he leaves. Answers any questions you have, clear and gives you the ideas on what he will do on exams so showing up and looking at what he posts will give you a lot of help. Just keep in mind, there was a two part project for the semester + exams so good luck. Prepares you for uni.
Lots of reading but super fair questions that make sense. Put in the work, get good mark

I enjoyed his class very much! I agree that you should read the textbook and not solely depend on lectures for tests. I recommend attending all lectures and taking detailed notes of the textbook. I promise, by doing this you will get a good grade:)
Evan was an okay prof but the lectures felt like I was there all day long as they went by so slow. It took a long time to get through the slides. The exams were not too hard.

Dr Caldbick was fantastic. Super interesting, smart, and instead of a midterm and final you had 4 in-person unit exams. He explained things well and was clear. Definitely read the textbook for the exams, and the assignments were incredibly simple and the TAs marked easily. Highly recommend!
Great prof but lectures were just him reading off the slides! Tests were relatively easy but reading the textbook definitely helps to do really good in the class.

The grading scheme he uses is interesting as it's a point system rather than traditional percentages. 4 exams: (3 in person, 1 online, with a 5th optional one that's also online to replace your lowest out of the 4). He takes your best 4 so I recommend doing it anyways. Exam questions for the MCQ were from textbook and slides; written was slides.

Evan was a decent prof, just very boring. PSYC 100 is a very boring class in general, but it didn't seem like he was interested in anything he was teaching, making it much harder to engage as a student. He barely got through 25 slides in 2 hours since he talked and answered many off topic questions. Also lot's of his explanations made no sense

awesome professor. I'm glad I got to learn my first psych course with Dr.Caldbick. He is very respectable, calming professor. He can teach you very well. Read the text(if you want an A), GO to his tutorials, ask questions about psychology or even your own experiences, slides are enough to pass the exams, but recommend reading the book

He's an amazing professor and is really clear on expectations. His classes aren't hard as long as you review your notes and exams aren't bad, mostly multiple choice. It's fair and assignments were short and easy, and will give you hints for the exam if you go to the shorter classes. His explanations are clear and easy to understand.
He is a great guy! If you go to the extra lectures, he gives the bonus questions on exams. He is straightforward and his explanations make sense. Overall the best professor I've had.

Mr. C was one of my first professors at SFU and he is amazing. His grading was fair and assignments were not too hard. Since it is a psychology class, expect to read alot and reviewing is a must. I've crammed the exams and it is way too difficult to cram all the information since it is quite heavy. Overall I would 10/10 take a class with him again.

Evan is very passionate in what he teaches, and it shows. There were 4 exams which is where majority of your grade comes from, but no final. The grading is a bit weird since your A range is a lot higher than regular courses. Exams were ok, a lot of the mc questions were in the textbook, however, written portions were a hit or miss.

He is a pretty good prof. I really liked this course because the exams were online. However that being said, they expect you to write more better for the written questions. Also, it is a little more difficult to get a good grade in this class because 90%+ is in the A range and 80%-90% is B range. Projects are short and are fun!
overall good prof and exams are easy if u've done any anatomy and physiology courses

The semester started well. Great review sessions for midterms and lectures were recorded. By the end of the semester, we didn't get a review class for the last exam, and the format was changed. I sent multiple emails that went unanswered to both him and the TA. This was a 5/5 prof in the beginning who fell off by the end when he was needed most.

Overall he was a really good Prof but he's a very hard marker for the midterms and finals. Final was cumulative and was going to focus on the last two chapters but focused much more on the other chapters which made it so much harder to study for. Being an intro course this was unacceptably super hard and boring. He has a monotone voice. Hated it.

His lectures were boring and almost half the class would leave during our break. The midterms were okay but were hard and very precise. No point in reading the book because his lectures are exactly from the readings. Overall I wouldnt take a class with him as a professor.
Lectures are long and boring, he basically reads off his slides. Grades were scaled most of the time and canvas quizzes+rps participation were grade boosters.

He is a very caring and sweet prof. His lectures are hard to understand, he posts the slides online but it would be helpful to attend. There are weekly quizzes for every chapter which is based on the book. His questions for exams and quizzes are nitpicky, so there's a lot to memorize (from the book and the lectures).

Dr. Caldbick is a fine professor, his lectures are HEAVILY based off the textbook with a little extra and he gives online quizzes for each chapter from the textbook. He encourages students to ask questions during lecture but it can be hard to get his attention. There are two midterms and the final is cumulative.

midterms and final were mostly application so it's better to understand each concept rather than memorizing word per word. quizzes were all textbook based so i recommend reading the book before taking the quiz. lecture was extremely boring and he reads it directly from slides, but if u pay close attention in lecture he tries to give examples.

Was a nice enough guy but not meant to be a prof. Hes quiet & introverted which made lectures extremely boring, 75 % of the class just played games during it. he read straight from slides & posted them for us bc people complained that he was too fast. mark based solely off online quizzes and 3 exams. exams hard compared to quizzes so every1 dropped

Be ready to read the book, and what i recommend is that go through every pages from the book, tho Caroline provides a few slides of powerpoint for us, but I feel like it doesn't help much in the test, most of the questions were asked from the book, if you don't read, i'm pretty sure u wont get what shes asking, Good Luck!

This class was very interesting, the topic covered was very much engaging. But you have to self-study and rely too much on the TEXTBOOK to get a decent grade. Every topic requires you to read over dozens of tedious and time-consuming pages. Lectures materials will help you with 1/3 of the exam. If you're planning to take this course,READ THE BOOK!

Caroline is an amazing professor, she explains psychology very clearly and holds some interesting activities in class to help us understand the definitions better. But we still need to read the textbook carefully after class to get a good grade in the exams because she may not talk all the contents in class.
Lots of work! Horrible! Poor professor

This course is so boring, I almost died mid-term!  However, Rose is really great.  He is amicable, helpful, organized, and precise. Up-to-date on-line and quick with the marks.  Psyc 100 is awful though(but easy)-- never again will I take any psychology!
Gordon is a great prof. Read the text and go to class and you will do awesome in this class. Hes a very nice guy, so if you need help, dont be afraid to go talk to him after class.
was okay for an introductory course

I do not recommend taking this course unless you want to earn a C even with endless efforts. Dr. Lim is nice but her and the TAs grading scheme are ridiculous and brutal. The lectures do not cover the chapters thoroughly and there is a lack of relevant and useful information. Therefore, intensive learning from textbooks is advised.

Did not learn much from this prof, her recorded lectures dont cover the whole chapter. Had to study thoroughly from the textbook and teach myself the course. Her and the TA grade harshly and she will not go out of her way to help you. I ended up with a decent grade, and thats only because the material isnt tough to understand.

I loved Dr. Lim. So far she has been my favourite prof at SFU! She is understanding and the content is fair as long as u do the readings and listen to the lectures. It was online and she is understanding of technical difficulties. She goes over questions on the quizzes each week that the class struggles with. Hope to have her as a prof again!

Dr. Lim's lectures are well thought out and she explains concepts and research very well. I would definitely recommend Dr. Lim if you're a psychology major. The course is thorough and reading is an absolute must, grading is also very fair! Dr. Lim is very approachable and nice, she will answer your questions with lots of thought! :)

The course is basically just the textbook. Fortunately for me, I took the course online so I was able to have my notes by my side. Her pre-recorded lectures help validate what you learned from the textbook but are super redundant. Her live lectures are useless because they cover topics that have already been quizzed on

Nice, approachable, and will answer questions. Very textbook heavy and they're paired with 3-8 lecture videos (10-40min/video) per chapter. Some lectures were tedious b/c they cover exactly what's in the TB, but not necessarily the information you'll be tested on. Final paper's hard so get feedback ASAP. Exam's easy if you read.

Dr. Lim a very hands off prof and doesnt seem to care much about teaching since her exams are based solely on the textbook and not lectures. She also implements an extremely difficult grading scale where an 87 average is needed for an A- and a 91 is needed for an A+.
"You're just overthinking it" That is the response to a critique I had for an exam. I have genuinely never had a worse response in my life.
His lectures are filled with info so attend them and study for quizzes.

Gives really great lectures and keeps you engaged. Readings are pretty heavy (about 20 pages/chapter), which is why there are 4 exams compared to one midterm and final. He posts lecture recordings online, so if you don't go to class, make sure to catch up as they are very useful! Not a GPA booster -- you've got to put in the work!

An awesome prof!  He has the right combination of assertiveness and firmness, but is also very caring, fair, and compassionate toward his students.  Attend class (lecture material is tested), read, and you'll do fine.  He's also hilarious and engaging - and the lectures are worth listening to.  Definitely recommend taking this class with him.

He is young but clearly loves what he teaches. I took this class as a major requirement but I had no interest in PSYC. He actually made it interesting and enjoyable. Read the textbook, go to the lectures, and you will do great.

If you're a 1st year, take his PSYC100 course. He is so thorough and specific that it'll really help you feel more comfortable with being in university. Although if you're in any year after your first, it can get a bit annoying because sometimes he takes so long. He has really clear criteria. I definitely recommend this class. Also he's a cutie.
Super hilarious and dorky guy. He's young so he makes an effort to use pop culture references. Lectures are easy to understand, and the readings are interesting! He's also super cute.

Lecture material differs from that in the textbook, but audio & slides are posted on Canvas. Quizzes and tests are quite straightforward and if you've taken notes and read the textbook, you will be fine. A lot of test questions are pulled from LaunchPad practice tests and Learning Curves, so I highly recommend using it to study.

I had 80% in the class and got a B-. The grading scheme is unfair. Most of my courses use a different scheme. Overall I found the course to be interesting and Alyssa is a good teacher. I could've got a higher grade with a different professor though. Read the textbook, highlight, as most of the content is from there. Go to class for hints on exams.

Pretty hard class because of the grading scale. But exams were not too difficult. You do have to study a lot to get a 'B' or higher grade. Would prefer if this was an online class due to lots of information to remember in a short amount of time for the exams.

She gave me a 0 on my exam for plagiarism, she gives out 5 different exams so you can't even copy off the person next to you, when i asked what i supposedly plagiarized, it was 3 sentences of information i wrote down to help me solve the question. she FAILED me a 0/70 just because i wrote down information to help me solve a problem.

PSYC102 Review - 30 question midterm and multiple choice, but you have to study an entire chapter of a textbook that is dense. get ready to be overprepared for absolutely no reason, and not know what to expect on an exam. sucks that a 100 course is so disorganized, and sort of designed to fail you.

Got only an extra day of studying for spending 5 days in the hospital and 5 days outside recovering and in this period I could not review or study. Oh boy an extra day of studying! compared to everyone else that had 10 more days than me it is pretty unfair but regardless the test wasn't too bad.

Professor Croft was my FAVOURITE prof. in my academic career so far. She was so passionate about what she taught and made her lectures so entertaining that she inspired me to switch my major as a 3rd year student. Such a lovely person but be ready to write a lot, refer to textbook readings and dig deeper for a good grade. Highhlllyyy recommend.

don't take her class if you have the option. Alyssa is approachable, and might answer any questions you have but her lecture slides suck - really dense and it's a long class so hard to keep up. heavy class time, heavy textbook (literally), and heavy exams. everything is online but obviously you HAVE to go to lecture to understand the exam questions

The sweetest prof, super clear about what she is looking for and easy to talk to. If you study and reach out for help when you need it, you'll do great. Messed up on the first exam 'cause I didn't read the textbook otherwise would've had an A.

i just took PSYCH 102 with her, why do i have a grade of a C- WHEN I HAVE A 70% ???????????????????????? WHAT IS THIS GRADING??????? sfu and their grading scale and going to post-secondary is impossible

She was a nice prof - had online quizzes for each chapter that you could attempt 5 times, then an online exam for every two chapters. The semester project was easy and not too time consuming. The lectures were interesting and engaging with videos and discussions. Just make sure you keep on top of dates and the textbook readings and you will be fine

Open book quizzes and tests?! HECK YEAH BOIH. Study for the quizzes and tests beforehand even if you're skimming through the textbook and you'll get at least a B-. It's hard to fail this course unless you MAJORLY slack off in the beginning.
Best prof ever in my first year. She makes many tests but those are open books.

She was a very nice prof and she tried to do group exercises during lecture to help engage the class. There is 4 exams which are open book. However, questions are asked from lectures and her slides aren't that detailed.

PSYC 100 was easy and she gives you many opportunities to increase your grade. The exams are online and open book, for the most part the questions are very fair. Overall the course is easy and enjoyable but you do have to read a chapter a week which can be very heavy amount of reading sometimes.

Dr. Croft is an absolute pleasure to learn from, and her classes are very well-organized. You are graded by four major exams (plus other tidbits) which are not cumulative. Attendance is not mandatory, but it is recommended to go to class, since the exams are based on the lectures. Grading scale was very tough though. 90 - 100% is,  A-range.
I had this as a first sem class and she was easy to understand. I liked how she had a exam every 2 units so we didn't need to know more than that. overall pretty good prof.

Her delivery of the course was a bit different due to the TSSU strike, however, she was very fair and caring towards her students. There are tests every 2 chapters that are based on lecture and textbook material so theres no midterm or final. Her lectures are very engaging and she delivers her content well.

Dr. Croft is a really fun and entertaining professor. She manages to make a three hour long lecture of pure notes entertaining and engaging. Her grading criteria is clear and it's easy to get a B or higher as long as you are willing to put in work and read as well. I'd recommend taking her class whenever you can!

P.S She's really easy to talk to

Overall a pretty good prof. The L2L projects (3 parts, worth about 25% of the grade) were SUPER easy and took at most 2 hours per part. Her lectures are quite long and it's easy to zone out quick. All short answer exam questions were on lecture material such as in class videos. No final. Make sure to really read the textbook.
Really interesting, interactive lectures despite large class size, approachable outside class and after lectures.
Great prof, tests are based 90% on the textbook. However, I would still recommend you to go to lectures because she asks questions based on the class demos or videos for the short answer portion

She was the best prof that I had this term. The grading was based on points that you were getting along the way from l2l project, practice quizzes (u have 5 chances for each) and 3 open book exams 1 bonus which replaced your lowest mark. No final exam which I found really nice. Her tests are not only based on textbooks but also lecture content.

Way better than Iris. She's caring, ensures her students are comfortable, understands that we have our own lives and our own struggles. She teaches in a way that makes info interesting, her exams are coherent, (which Gordon can't relate to). Gives breaks often, and is just a lovely person. The definition of a great person, prof and deserves a raise

An absolute angel! I highly recommend. Lectures were quite long/content-heavy; I found myself zoning out often. Very fair exam questions; majority of questions were textbook-based, although there were questions that were only touched on in lecture. Pay attention to the videos shown in class. She offers a bonus exam to replace your lowest exam mark!

This was her first year at SFU, and she did an amazing job teaching this course. The exams were filled with relevant information related to the textbook and things we did or learned about in lecture. Overall, this course was not too hard for a 100, but challenging enough that I needed to learn to study properly. Alyssa is smart and inspirational!

Ms.Croft is one of the best professors at Sfu. She is incredibly caring. There is no final or midterm. You should attend the lectures because the written part of the tests is based off what is said in lecture. My only issue is that I got a 96 in the class and still only got an A and not an A+. The grading scale is very harsh. Still the best prof!

She's very captivating at times and entertains the class with activities at times but overall, covers less than a third of what comes on each exam. Most of the reading and learning will be on your part through the textbook chapters which are loooong. Apart from that she is very caring and the way to get fulfill credits is very easy.

She is very nice as a person. 

Tests are online and open book but very difficult with lots of tricky questions, which is made much worse by the time crunch. It's 1 minute/point. Hard to get a B. Get ready to read and know the whole chapter for every test if you plan on passing. Lots of exam questions are only covered in lecture.

Lectures are boring, she doesn't post the slides before only after so you can't follow along. The class itself is easy, not bad. 4 exams and 2 chapters for each exam. There are 3 assignments that are online and super easy to do, they take about 2 hours each at most. There are practice quizzes on each chapter, where you have many tries (online).

Dr. Croft is a very positive, fun, and engaging professor. Although the material is heavy and the textbook includes a lot of reading, she manages to make it interesting and fun through her lectures! You will have to read the entire chapter taught in lecture in the textbook as she covers only the main things.The exams were all online and mostly MC!
You will have to read the whole textbook to teach yourself the material because she won't cover a lot of it in lecture.

She is very nice and is willing to help you if you have questions. You will need to read the textbook regardless if you attend the lectures (which I'd recommend). Some questions on the exam are from things she said in the lecture and can't be found in the power point slides or textbook.

She is an alright professor, but her style of teaching makes me mad. Why do I show up to lectures if we miss half the lesson and are still expected to read the textbook with her lecture and the literal half that she leaves out? I understand that PSYC 100 is quite heavy but dude come on half the unit is missing.

Very nice professor. Graded on syllabus quiz (EASY), research participation (EASY), learning to learn Project series (EASY), practice quizzes with 5 retakes, 4 exams (exam every 2 chapters). Exams were very fair with simple questions. No midterms or final. Read the textbook and take notes, you will succeed if you study. enjoyed her a lot

She is a friendly professor. However, you won't do well in this class if you do anything except read the textbook. No point going to the lecture. The slides aren't available until after it ends, so you can't follow along-instead you're left scrambling trying to take notes... most of what's shown in the lecture isn't even going to be tested ever.
If you get the chance to take a course with Dr. Coupland you should! She was absolutely amazing and such a good professor when it came to explaining and teaching the material.

She's very good at explaining the material and providing support and additional explanations if needed. I overall felt comfortable approaching her with questions I had, and I have a good experience with this class
really enjoyed the prof and her teaching style. class was fun for the most part
I really liked going to lectures to get a better understanding of what we were learning that day. She was able to talk in lectures in a way that I could understand/ write down what she was saying.

VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT HER FIELD AND IS VERY ENGAGING IN LECTURE. MAKES LECTURE VERY ENGAGING AND ENJOYABLE. HOWEVER, TESTS WERE EXTREMELY DIFFICULT AND WOULD OFTEN HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH CONTENT LEARNED IN LECTURE. MUST READ THE TEXTBOOK

The professor did a great job at executing engaging lectures. I enjoyed attending lectures due to the professor's encouraging student questions and her fun personality. she also did a good job at explaining course material in the textbook in a more easy to understand way.

Shes a great prof! I was worried the whole semester that I wasnt going to do well but then I ended up getting an A - everyones grade went way up at the end. I loved lectures and I really liked that our lowest exam grade doesnt count towards our final grade.

Dr. Coupland is an amazing prof who cares about her students. Her lectures are light and they usually supplement the textbook material. Yes, you do have to read the textbook in this class but thats the reality with most university courses. You do need to pay attention to do well but if you do pay attention and do the readings, you can do well.

i don't know where everyone else in the class went to highschool but this wasn't a super hard class? i definitely didn't do great (though i know our marks will get curved so i'm sure it's not that bad), but people need to chill out. this is university, it's supposed to require work.

She knows majority of her students are first years and she still does not go easy on the exams. She will make them very difficult no matter how much you read the textbook. The one assignment she had given will boost up your grade but to do well on the exams you will need to memorize each and every word in the textbook.

Honestly a great prof! One of the best I've taken at SFU. Easy to approach and seems to care if you do well. She's engaging and genuinely makes the content interesting (at least to an engineering student). Exams in person so be ready to study (and read the textbook), but easy MCQ.

for those other reviewers that are saying she's a bad prof, they've clearly never taken a university class. You're supposed to read in university and learn the material! Her exams are fair and she said lectures were intended to supplement the textbook, so don't blame her for not reading the syllabus

Doesnt go over half the material in the textbook during lectures but everything ( all textbook material + lecture material ) is fair game for the exam. The questions are multiple choice but extremely difficult. Would not recommend taking it with this professor.

although she's a good prof. she gives clear real-life examples during lectures and the lectures are interesting. she picks the best 3 out of the 4 exams. the exams are extremely hard. although they are multiple-choice. it is mostly scenario-based + it's not fairly given. I would recommend taking another prof but if u have no choice, then go for her

Dr. Coupland is a very professional, easy to understand teacher who makes concepts fairly easy to understand. The exams happen to not be very fair as they are standardized testing and focus on topics in the textbook that did not get covered in class. Exams include concepts that would be easily missed in the textbook.

Dr. Coupland is good at teaching the concepts and they are easy to understand, however the exams are not fair. The exam mostly covers topics in the textbook that aren't even mentioned during the lectures and they're really focused on statistics or minor details that are really easy to miss rather than what you would assume is important.

as long as you read the textbook, take notes, and understand what you just read and took notes on -- you're set. i suggest attending his in-person lectures because they can be helpful and he tells you what to focus on. recorded lectures aren't needed to do well. the TAs that mark the written assignments can be hard markers! [fall 2021]
Definitely a class where you need to put in effort. Hard to get high marks on quizzes. Doesnt teach during lectures. TAs mark super hard. Doesnt feel like a 100 level course.

Honestly, if you do the readings weekly that are around 30 pages, take notes and understand the big ideas youll be fine. He drops the lowest exam scores, the only difficult part was the written assignments that the TAs marked extremely hard for a 100 level class.
Had him for both 100 and 102 and if you are completely new to psyc (even tho this is supposed to be an intro course) and a 1st yr who doesn't already have good study habits this will be a struggle.

Did not teach in our lectures, the only reason we were there was to take tests. The textbook chapters were very long and boring at times, so it would have helped to be taught in class. He seems like a nice person, but not the best prof.

Seems like a great guy, but he doesn't teach during lectures. Pretty interesting material sometimes, but lots of reading and memorizing to do all on your own. Lots of quizzes and a couple exams, but the in person writing assignments were the worst. Was excited for this class but only ended up happy that I didn't choose to major in psychology.

I took PSYC100 with Dr Day as an elective; If you're not committed to reading 30-40 pages a week, You will have a very hard time surviving as there are weekly quizzes/bi-weekly exams. He doesn't teach during his lectures, so the whole course is pretty much self taught which is super disappointing. Overall very difficult for an intro psych course :/

Literally ruined my life. tricked into taking this class as I thought it was an intro/first year psyc class. weekly quizzes, so much reading, biweekly exams and timed in class-essay writes, also a couple difficult/time consuming assignments. Literally terrible despite my best efforts. should not be a level100 course only worth 3 credits. horrible

This course definitely does not feel like a level 100 course. Although he drops 2 quizzes, 1 test, and 1 assignment, you are basically learning solely through the textbook. Lectures mostly consist of q&a and they do not really go over the content of the course. Lecture times will also be mainly test or quiz time. Would not recommend this prof.

Exams and quizzes were open book and based 99% on the textbook. 2/8 quizzes & 1/4 exams with the lowest score were omitted. A very nice prof but I stopped going to lectures because they were unnecessary and recorded. Only a couple of assignments and plenty of time to complete them. Overall, would take another class with him.
Worse prof ever. You have to get really deep into the textbook to earn marks in exams. Go check other profs on these psychology intro courses.

This course was completely self-taught. Everything in the textbook is fair game, and if you memorize that you're good to go. Quiz and exam questions can be tricky, but lowest mark for each is dropped. Did better on these when I stopped watching pre-recorded lectures and just focused more on the textbook. Live lectures are basically 30min Q&As.

He drops 2/8 quizzes and 1/4 exams (lowest marks) which is really nice! It's a pretty straight forward course. His "narrated shows" are short compared to other classes but he still talks pretty slow so I recommend listening in 1.75x speed. If you study the textbook and watch the lectures at the same time you're golden!

Dr. Day truly cares about his students, especially since he allows for 2 of 6 quizzes to be dropped as well as 1 of 4 term exams! Although his lectures were hard to follow sometimes since they could get long and boring, the textbook will keep you well informed. I highly suggest him as a prof!

Lectures are useless, as long as you read and understand the textbook, you will do fine. He also drops 2 out of 8 quizzes and 1 out of 4 exams which is super nice if you don't understand a certain topic. Day was not much help at all as I taught the entire course to myself but the content is easy. Tests and quizzes combined are 84% of your grade

He was really, really good at giving practical and helpful lectures. Prepare to read lots though. Quizzes were highly easy, Midterms were a little difficult but doable to get A's consistently if you don't slack off.

Weekly quizzes and iClicker questions so class is essentially mandatory. Knows the lectures by heart and is clearly interested in the topics. I was never bored some other students didn't like him. Extremely organized, all quizzes are planned in advance and grading is as in the syllabus. No feedback on the assignment. The etext site is very helpful.
Russell Day is a great prof to have for psych. He is passionate, engaging, and funny. He clearly outlines criteria in class and don't expect to get perfect if you skip lectures.

His lectures are really boring but he tries to make it interesting. Really don't even need to come to class. Just show up for iclicker quizzes and exams. You're better off reading the textbook than attending his lectures. His exams have an MCQ part and an essay part. He usually tells you the essay part the class before so make sure to go that day.
You don't need to go to lecture but READ the textbook. Most multiple choice questions are example scenarios, essay question is really difficult. Boring prof and same with his lectures.

Lectures were dry and boring, as most of the material is ripped right out of the textbook. Russell tries his best to make the class entertaining, but fails as he goes on random tangents sometimes. Attend lectures for the iclicker quizzes, and read the textbook religiously. The average for the essay parts of the exam were really close to failure too

Professor Day is a really nice guy, if you have any questions you can always email him and he'll reply very quickly. Attendance isn't necessary, unless for iClicker quizzes/exams. However he does give tips to what will be on the exam. READ YOUR CHAPTERS BEFORE YOU GO TO CLASS, it will help in the long run. Go to listen to his lecture.

Really enjoyed this prof! 4 midterms not cumulative. No "surprise questions" on exams, basically read the textbook, memorize the concepts and ideas and youll do great. The lowest quiz mark as well as the lowest test mark is dropped PLUS additional 6% for research participation. He tries to make lectures fun and engaging.

Great experience. Buy the LaunchPad and textbook, do the launchpad questions and use quizlet to study. Easiest A+. 4 term exams (non cumulative) so just memorize the night before. 7 iclicker quizzes. Worst term exam and worst iclicker quiz mark gets dropped (very forgiving course). Easy A for sure! Prof is decent. But just read the textbook :)

Lectures were definitely optional; I stopped attending unless quiz/test and I still received a great grade, just make sure to read the text closely. Made dry material as interesting as possible when I did attend lectures. TA marking was great and appropriate for an intro course. Very approachable guy overall; called me dear when I spoke to him :)

I give him props for trying to make the material interesting. Besides that: attending lectures not necessary unless exam/quiz day. There's lots to read (1 ch/wk), but quizzes help you stay on track. Tests are based off the text with essay/MC sections. Good guy, but not my type of prof.

Overall a good class. Reading the entire chapter that week and writing notes to study is how I began doing better. Self-study is more important than attendance. Only note of warning is the essay portion of exams are RIDICULOUSLY graded. I have failed 2/3 of them so far. Multiple choice itself is hard too.   no tutorial that's one plus

Seems like a pretty nice guy; he tried to make the lecture interesting. The lecture wasn't very helpful though, since you have to memorize everything in the book anyway. Test questions were pretty fair. He gives hints as to what the essay questions will be like. Overall, a pretty good choice for introductory psychology.
Lecture notes are not useful at all. Just memorize EVERYTHING in the textbook and you'll be fine. Tough grading on the essays though. Our class average for those was 50% or lower.

Office hours are a joke. Any question slightly harder than basic comprehension will get you the vaguest answer, leaving you wondering why you are paying money for profs who don't know the content. He often has to look up the answers for even the basic questions. I understand why he always wants us to see TAs. Coursework is fine; prof not so much.

Course content itself is manageable but I did not enjoy the class because the prof himself is not very helpful. Doesn't know the material enough to answer his own test questions. Foists off all the work on the poor TAs. I did very well, but not due to this prof. I found him to be kind of rude and judgemental, really old fashioned. Not recommended.

I've had better lecturers who knew their stuff a lot more than he did.   I once asked if I could see my recent midterm, because he holds the ones for disabled students, but he called me "obsessive" for wanting to. Rude.  Not approachable or encouraging to students keen to learn more & doesn't know how to do his own test questions. Not recommended.

Need a B-Soc that is both interesting and straightforward? Psyc is probably for you! Day is an amazing lecturer! Even if you have 2 hour lectures, he manages to make the topics seem very interesting and relatable. Slides are given and note taking is a breeze. Bi-weekly quizzes & 4 midterms + short cumulative. Read the text and you're good to go.
Prof is mean

Good Proff, engaging throughout lecture. Lots of information to memorize. Using launchpad to read the textbook and taking practice tests were very useful for the iclicker quizzes. The essay portion of the exams are tricky, but just write down as many relevant points as possible. For the assignment, be sure to have enough time for research.

Exams are hard, but the final is all multiple choice worth 40% of your grade. He is by far the greatest prof i've ever had. He makes the lectures very interesting and uses many examples to pull aside from the textbook. Textbook is mandatory. iclicker quizzes are fair if you read the textbook. All and all, great professor.

Russell Day is a great prof. He knows what he's talking about, inside and out. Recommend him as a prof. I had him for Psych 100 and I look forward to taking future Psychology courses with him! The slideshows for his lectures are also posted online, which is a huge plus. Make sure you read the textbook!
Gave incorrect information about a psych condition I actually have; argued with me when I corrected him, told me 'well, you should know all about inaccurately stereotyped symptom.'

Day is an awesome prof! Interesting lecture and never boring. Material can be dry but makes it interacting. 1 chapter reading per week and iclicker after every chapter. Written part of midterm can be tricky with time managing, MCQ are very situational. Would not recommend taking both 100102 together with this prof due to heavy reading.

Hes a good teacher, lectures were helpful in the beginning than got progressively less useful. If you read the textbook and do the launchpad questions you are set to go. Lots of reading for sure. But if you work relatively hard an A at least, is not hard to get.

It is quite a bit of work like you would expect from any introductory course, but material is straight-forward and interesting. Readings are long so keep up, but the content itself is not difficult. Most of the bad reviews are probably from people who didn't try hard enough and ended up with low marks. Put in the effort and you'll be fine!

Format was 7 i-clicker quizzes and 4 term exams. We were graced with the opportunity of omitting our worst quiz and term exam. Quizzes were very straightforward, exams were a little tougher. Read the textbook to do well on MC, know how to critically apply and relate the material to do well on the written portion. Textbook  Lectures.

Great lecturer, keeps us all engaged. Lots of quizzes and midterms but they're easy enough if you read the textbook (which is a must since he bases the entire course off of it) His lectures aren't really that important if you read the textbook though, so don't worry about skipping now and then (or all the time)

This course requires heavy constant reading. You'll have to read like 5 pages everyday to do well in this course. Exams are somewhat fair. 48 multiple choice questions and an essay. The written part was VERY hard, not many people finished it on time. There are research programs that you'll have to make an extra appointment and participate.

I took an intersession course with him, so 3 times a week. There were 4 term exams, a bunch of iClicker quizzes and an assignment. Honestly, I'm sure I could have achieved an A if I really tried, but I managed to get a B+ with minimal effort (in my opinion, it was minimal - I did the readings but slacked). Didn't do so well on quizzes. STUDY.

Dr Days grading scale is what really messed me over in this course. I got 80 in the course and got B on transcript, w/o any scalling. Important to mention that he has many many tests, quizzes etc. For the amount of work you put into the course, you wouldnt get the grade you deserve. If you have to take a course with him, do so, otherwise avoid him.

Dr. Day is wonderful! He is approachable and he makes lectures informative and interesting. :) The course has a lot of information so you have to keep up with the material.  Read the textbook (iclicker quizzes are based on textbook material)! Exams are fair though the written portion can get tricky.
Amazing professor; awesome course. Informative and simple

Interesting prof, passionate about the material. Exams have essays which kind of screw you over, make sure to read the assigned articles. The MC is easy. Overall the course is alright, not a GPA booster if not interested in psychology

I took both introductory courses with Dr. Day. I would strongly recommend against this though. I had to drop PHIL100 because I had no time for anything but psyc. Attendance isn't mandatory unless you have a quiz or exam. Overall, the courses are based off the textbook.
Not bad. But you seriously have to read the textbook

Great prof, loved his class. It's a very interesting course. Essays on midterms are marked quite hard but the final brings up the mark. Heavily textbook based course. He keeps his lectures interesting.

DO NOT TAKE. So much more difficult than other professors. No time at all to do the midterms essays when the MC requires critical/analytical thinking. Too many iClicker quizzes. I would definitely not recommend this professor although he is a somewhat humorous guy.

EVERYTHING heavily relies on the textbook. I worked my butt off and the class avg for most midterms was 55%.Some midterm questions were based on certain facts that can be missed so read EVERYTHING. If you think "he wont", he WILL put it on the exam. Classes mandatory for iclicker quiz days but I didn't show up for useless regular days

GOOD: extremely strong lecturer/speaker. he knows exactly what hes talking about, and makes lectures so interesting that u dont wanna miss. BAD: a lot of work! be prepared to study every week, u have to bc quizzes. LONG chapters. its not hard, its just A TON of material to grasp in short time and lots of studying..lots of reading

His lectures are really intriguing. Some concepts that you won't be able to understand by the book, he will make it easy to grasp during his lectures. The only difficult part is the essay questions he ask in his mid-terms.

Very tough course! Lots of content and GOOD LUCK on the essay portion of exams - they're marked very hard. Seems like a nice guy but comes across a little condescending. Interesting content, but lots of reading and you HAVE to keep up with it. iClicker tests are fair.
Very informative course relied heavily on the textbook. Attending lecture is not so much helpful except to do i-clicker quizzes.

Really enjoyed his class. Thought he was a good speaker, really helpful. The exams are hard, especially the essay parts. Quizes weren't too bad, they helped to know what to study for the exam. Do all the readings and take good notes. Overall, good prof.

Hillarious guy!! I thoroughly enjoyed all his classes. I could have done better in his class if I hadn't slacked off with my readings. DO ALL YOUR READINGS ON TIME and try to understand the content rather than just reading it and you'll easily ace the course! Definitely reccomend it!

Just do all the online questions and you'll be fine.  He's an interesting guy.  I found he was a fair marker for all except the assignment which didn't really make sense.  Mickey Mouse course for sure.

Thought he was an awesome prof, very entertaining. Psyc 100 definitely isn't an easy walk in the park class. There is a lot of work, but it is do-able. The marking of the written sections on the last two midterms were brutal- so maybe try to better on the first one? #1 THING- READ THAT TEXTBOOK

Russell is a great speaker. Though lectures are not mandatory for success in the course, lectures are very entertaining and worth the time. Make sure you read the textbook thoroughly and you'll do great in the course. Russell was very open to providing help during office hours. Great course overall.
Excellent speaker. Knows what he talks about. Class is straight forward and interesting for most chapters. Keep up with readings cuz quizzes are from the book.
He's a bit boring but very clear. Lectures can get boring too, but as long as you keep up with readings and do well on i-clicker quizzes, you're set. Seems like a nice guy though

Great intro psych course. Lectures were interesting but not always relevant to the quizzes/exams. What's most important is to read and understand the textbook. Do the I-Clicker quizzes. Professor Day can be intimidating in person so if you have questions, ask your TM.
he's awesome! although he talks most talks about what's in the text, he makes the material much more interesting. Also, he treats all students 100% equally.

Took this course last term. He was really boring in class. No need to listen to his lectures. It was pure reading off the textbook for this course. I-clicker questions are reasonable. Rude when I approached him to ask him a question.
Worst prof ever!So much homework to do.Not kind to students.NEVER take his class!!

Worse prof ever! who ever says they like him r crzy! he mocks you when you ask him a question. His TA are even worse they give marks out of no where and they just want to get rid of you as fast as possible and when you set up a appointment with them they don't even show up or if they do they want to leave as soon as possible. take a diff prof for i
Good prof who get's the material across quite well.  Assigns too much reading though if you ask me.  Pretty funny too!

Before when I didn't read the textbooks, I thought the course was really difficult. But when I actually READ the textbooks before quizzes and tests (like, just once), it was a breeze. Well, multiple choice questions are. Essays are extremely difficult. MT Essay class avg: 1) 9/30 2) 11/30. It's ridiculous.
If you read the book and take notes, it's not hard to get an A  in this subject. He was very helpful and passionate!

His teachings are alright, but he's kinda hard to get along with well. His multiple choice is really hard. He doesn't finish lecturing before he gives quizes. Some of his TAs are bad = losing marks for stupid things. personally I didn't enjoy talking with him or anything. I love the class, not the prof.
Fun class, fun prof, but the quizzes and exams were based on the textbook, so attendance to lecture is purely optional. Fairly easy, you just need to read the text.
Excellent prof! Very funny, and helpful, and the course is interesting as well. Read the textbook and memorize as much as possible, a lot of multiple choice. Reading ahead will be useful
the lectures were fun but he just briefs through the chapters. mostly you just concentrate on reading the textbooks and the open labs were easy marks as long as you read it.

Overall a pretty good prof, well-known for his blue shirts, music before lecture and mini-demos in class. Textbook reading is CRUCIAL for this course! It's a good idea to make notes or cue cards and to try to stay ahead on the reading. Final exam was all multiple choice and relatively easy =)

Pretty cool prof, very passionate about the things that he teach. always makes funny and corny jokes and we listend to disturbia before class! the only bad thing is, lots of textbook reading and memorizing terms. CLASS is NOT mandatory :)

A well-organized and well-run 1st year class.  Exams are fair.  Lectures are interesting/entertaining, but ultimately next to useless in preparing you for exams, which there are a lot of, plus quizzes.  Read the book, understand the concepts (not difficult), and memorize the bolded terms!  Material isn't hard but requires work (reading.)
Good prof overall! His lectures are somewhat useful,but not for me at least because i read the book instead of listening to what he saids in class. Thus, attending to this class in not mandatory.

he's hard.. at least harder than i thought. his exams are really into little details. requires lots of memorization + application.. also, i took this course for elective and i didn't really need it and i end up studying more for this course than my other courses.. when i ask him some questions, he didn't really give enough help or answer....
tests are very hard.  he is a nice guy, very approachable.  Tends to waste a lot of time at the beginning of the lecture talking about things which aren't related to psyc
Awesome prof, you can tell he is passionate about teaching. Expects a lot from students and is very helpful. He is also super funny and plays Queen at the beginning of every lecture - its great!
SERIOUSLY such a good prof! loved him!
Great prof!
Great Professor! He uses great examples to demonstrate psychological points which makes them much more salient. His lectures are interesting so make sure you go!
His classes are useless. You must read the text.

for this class, the notes are not indepth so to do well, READ THE TEXT again and again and also understand the bolded terms in the textbook...the short answer parts of midterms were tough(hint: define and explain everything and write lots).. prof gives some good examples to understand concepts..the material itself is interesting
Dr. Day is great! The first test was hard, then it gets easier. He makes the lectures real fun. Lots of examples. Loved the class loved him.
Good prof

I took PSYC 100 and 102 with him. Very nice and approachable guy, also very interested in the subject. He treats everyone like an elementary kid in lectures. His exams (written part) is based on his lecture notes, however the Multiple Choice you really have to read every page of the chapter in the the text book. I would recommend it.
not bad guy

Good at lecturing. Exams are somewhat tough since you have to apply the knowledge rather than regurgitate, but his teaching style is easy to follow and not too dry. Definitely the guy you want if you're taking psyc 100.
Really great prof.... attending lectures makes everything alot more clear than it is in the text. Fair workload... tough exams, more understanding and applying info than memorizing!

Didn't like his lecture style at all - treats students like we're in elementary school!  Until the exams, that is - very hard!  Sounds like others like his style, but if you don't like being talked down to, avoid his class.  Also, he only covers a fraction of what's on the exams in his lectures.
He makes class really interesting
great guy; not too strict but not too lenient either; learned A LOT; lectures are never boring even if the topics are
He is a good prof. Helps alot. Thx

The material...kinda hectic and a workload! But the Prof!?!?!?! FAULTLESS!!!!!!!!!!! His lectures were one of the few where i actually wasn't interested in listening online at all. COme hell or high water...i had to go and see what he'd do. If you get the chance...GO FOR IT!

the class? not as easy as one thinks.  the prof?  ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC.  funny, informative, and concise.  can command a class of 400 effortlessly and makes it seem like he's just having a convo with you.  if you are interested in psyc and day's teaching it...DON'T HESITATE!
hard test especially on mutiples choices, a lot of memorization in order to do well
his lectures were pretty interesting..but there's quite a bit to do in the course
Great prof. yeah a bit high school like but so what? Nice guy to talk to. One of the few classes that can keep me awake.

Dr. Day is a great prof. The lectures are fun, and cover a decent amount of material. The material could relate a bit more to the tests, you can definatly afford to miss lectures if need be. good Psyc prof, with hard hard tests.

You don't learn anything from him. He makes dumb jokes. He spent so long to lecture on a topic but less valuable information is given. Very often you see students sleeping, playing games on their laptops or leaving early.

What is with all the smiley faces. Ok yeah, he is pretty easy and clear, but he is sooo annoying. i cannot stand him. At least everything is in the textbook and I don't have to go to lecture. The worst teacher I have ever had. Way too high school.
Definitely my favorite prof and perfect for a first year course.  His lectures are organized, structured and he knows how to keep the class entertained.  Quite funny!

Very hard course, but Dr Day makes it so enjoyable and worth your efforts. amazing guy if you go and have a chat with him. Very personable and genuinely interested to know you as a person. Would recommend him as a prof any day.
Fun and interesting class, makes readings for the class more interesting as well. What else can i say?

He makes the lecture interesting! He gives fair exams but the essay section is being marked too hard! One should never expect a "PSYC 100" student capable of writing something possible to contribute to psychology. Materials in this course is ove

Very engaging prof.  Makes lectures interesting to listen to, I always looked forward to them.  Material taught is also very interesting, but amount of information can be overwhelming.  Don't fall behind in your readings in this class.
nasty midterms (2 of em) final isn't so bad - thinks he's smarter than he is
fun and interesting prof. but lectures can be boring
Good prof, moderate difficulty assignments and papers
Excellent prof!  but exams are kinda tough and a lot of course work
Very fun, exciting class...easy to understand, always available
Great prof.  The only lecture I go to that I can stay awake in :)
choose his course and you won't feel miserable...
No Comments
Nasty midterm and final. BE HAPPY WITH A "B" AND UP.
No Comments
No Comments
funny guy; very disorganised thoughts, though, when it comes to lectures

She seems like a nice person, but she is not the best prof. The concepts are so simple and straight forward but she doesn't teach them as if they are. There's no point in going to class other than for iclickers/exams. Memerize EVERYTHING in the textbook. It's a pretty easy class you just have to memorize. Assisgnments are okay.
final is harder than midterm. midterm is not so hard if u studied. must read the textbook to get high score for the exams. i recommend this class.

Teaching style is good, her quizzes are mark boosters, assignments are pretty easy. But there is TOO much reading.  You will def get a good grade if you put in effort. My only complaint was that the TAs and Prof were not very willing to help. I went to prof's office to ask where my TA was during her office hrs and i was told to go find her myself.

I'm surprised by some of the comments here. She's a pretty decent prof. Taking this course as intersession definitely means there's a lot more reading to do. But as long as you keep on tab of things, doing well on this course shouldn't be a problem She keeps the lectures interesting by showing us videos and demos.
I dont think this class is easy for me...Too much reading and the assignments  are time consuming...She curves the grade and...too many quizzes

Her lecture is super slow and boring. It fells like she couldnt keep up with her schedual everytime. And it makes no sense to me that we need to do the quiz prior to the actual lecture just b/c shes so slow. The amount of work is quite huge, but it also makes it easy to have better grade.

I agree that her lectures are incredibly boring... The course itself is interesting but I find her lectures just feel slow and painful. The amount of work is fair though, and she's pretty quick to respond to students on webct.

EASY CLASS! you MUST read the textbook. Don't really need to attend lecs, except for iclicker quizes;  she posts the notes and her lecs are recorded. Easy marks for assignments. You can EASILY get a B in the class, and if you put the time in, defs an A!
Not the best prof. Unorganized, and seems to waste time in class handing in assignments slowly etc. I would recommend George Alder for psyc 100 and 102, he's great..she should learn from him!!
Unclear, and extremely disorganized. Just MEMORIZE the textbook to prep yourself. Can pick on pinpoint details. Mansour is not very helpful.
OK Class.

Most boring lectures ever, exams are insanely hard and nitpicky, 85% of grade comes from exam and over all she's just mean and a bad prof, Iris gordon Is better, I took her for psych 102 and that says alot.

Her exams were hard, her lectures were boring and everything about this class sucked. Her exams had 6 questions that were very obscure and there were 3 exams and our entire grade was based on that and a research. Don't take this with her. It's not worth it when you can take this class with easier profs
Found this professor to be very difficult to learn from, often going off topic and talking about something else completely unrelated to the course material. Wouldn't take again
Sherrie is a decent lecturer, but her class can be tough - exams are challenging and she doesn't always cover everything in depth. Attend lectures and use resources like unstuck ai to prepare.
Unclear criteria for tests which are completely written. Doesn't give feedback at all. Intentionally lowers the test scores when the TAs want to give better scores.
Super easy prof. Just three exams, so if you're not a fan of a million portions in a course, this prof is rly for you. Very good lecturer as well

Sherrie is pretty funny and overall a decent lecturer, but she can be extremely condescending when answering questions in class. She sometimes behaves like teaching first-years is a personal inconvenience and an introductory course is a waste of her time. Exams are tough, but not unmanageable.
3 big exams that pretty much determines your final grade, none cumulative. 3hrs lecture was hard to endure but she tries her best to make it bearable.

You could really tell that Sherrie knew a lot about psychology and she loved it. She often told stories about her personal life and other things going on outside of class, but I found that they always related to the material and helped put things into perspective.

lectures can be so funny but sometimes she would spend 45 minutes on 5 slides and then rush through the rest. the exams were kind of difficult so make sure you really pay attention to what she stresses in lecture and study that. good luck
One of my worst courses that I've ever taken in university

Her lectures were fun and I enjoyed having her but the exams were very tough. One question was one slide that she didn't talk much about. 3 hour classes but she sometimes let us out early. TA'S are tough markers. Our class average was a C so make sure to attend lecture as she mentions things that are the exam in more detail

Lectures are 3 hours long and Atwood rambles off topic. Lecture slides have all the info needed for exam. 3 exams that make 94% of your grade. Exams are 6-7 written LONG answers and marked incredibly harshly. Our class average was close to a fail every time but it is on a curve. HIGHLY consider taking this course with a different prof if possible.

Sherrie does her lec well, engages with the class and has good humour. She does a lot of random stuff in class you may find questionable but it makes the whole class laugh. If you care about your grade you should go to class but she posts her slides online. Sometimes it's difficult to stay awake by the end of her class but it's not too bad.
i didnt attend a single lecture and ended up getting above average for every exam. the readings are helpful, and her lecture slides have all the info youll need for the exam.
LMAO RUNNNNNN

Enthusiastic but rambles a lot about random things at times. Lectures are 3 hours but there are typically only like 40 slides in total. Tests are pretty tough, even if you aren't a first-year. At least she tries to make the tests easier if the grades are coming back too low. Oh yeah, and your entire grade is based on tests.

You're expected to study from at least 5 slideshows for each exam, with each slideshow containing at least 50 slides, but the exams only contain a few topics. Attendance is important as she only says what *might* be on exams and does not have exam reviews. When asked what will be on exams, she often doesn't know as she has not written them yet.

I learned a lot in her class. Compared to other profs her material is very well structured, just make sure to read each chapter before the lecture and also go to the lectures. If you actually care about the material and pay attention in class, you should have to issues writing the tests.

Broad concepts covered, but she makes lecture interesting enough + is somewhat humorous and helpful during office hours if needed. TONS of reading for the course, memorization-heavy. Some questions on quizzes/midterms are nowhere in textbook or lecture...? But assignments are simple. Class is a breadth course compared to Physics, Chem, etc.

her exams are worded so weirdly and they don't really relate to what we learned in the lecture. wouldn't take her again, exams are worth 60% of your grade and most of the questions don't even make sense

I wanted to try psychology because I like it but this course made it clear to me that psychology courses are not for me. The quizzes were worded very weirdly which made them difficult to answer. I felt like I didn't learn much during the lectures as well.
Most of the class will leave mid lecture due to the lack of use her lectures ever produce, never take this course.

Overall not bad. She had four exams every two chapters (3 online) + 4 assignments which I really liked. Exam wording was confusing at times and did not relate to what we were taught or read in the textbook but they weren't difficult. A lot of people didn't like her but I thought she was pretty funny. If you put in the work, you will do well.

The tests are extremely frustrating because each question is worded like a riddle. Even if you study every detail of the material, your hard work is not reflected in your grade. The criteria for the assignments was also very confusing, and the marking and feedback was not consistent with the information the students were given.

Sherrie was never clear on what her expectations were for our assignments. It felt like she gave her TA's a different rubric than what she gave the students. She had a midterm every few weeks which was nice, however, a lot of the questions were difficult to understand because of how they were worded.
Never take her class, doesn't seem showing respect to her students..

Sherrie was an alright prof. The lectures weren't too useful since all the material was in the textbook aside from a few key details she pointed out. I mostly read the textbook in lecture and wrote down the few key details she about assignments or in-class videos. Material isn't hard but the exam wording is confusing even if you know the material.

Although Sherrie is a funny and entertaining professor, midterms were worded in a weird way. Your mark really depends on what TA you have as some mark harshly while others are lenient. Their feedback does not help and even getting an appointment with them, you don't have much luck. If you don't have to take this course, avoid it.

Sherrie is infuriating. You could spend days memorizing every defintion and term but it will do NOTHING for you on the test. Her tests are worded SO strangely that it takes a significant amount of time trying to understand them. She only gives you 55 minutes for a 40 question application based exam. She is rude and doesn't respond to emails.

I liked Sherrie. I did the readings before class and her lectures helped clarify the textbook material. Exactly what you need a prof to do, help you learn the material. Her tests were tough to combat the cheating for people who wrote online. Part of the online problem all prof's face. Very personable which made her lectures interesting.

Strange. Her exams are oddly worded. Have to read the questions several times over just to understand what they are asking. You also need to know a collection of random facts here and there, which most likely are not in the slides.

Great professor, gave lectures that were interesting and had memorable anecdotes. Consisted of 4 assignments, and 4 exams (2 in-person, 2 online or in-person). Some of the exam questions were somewhat tricky, but if you understand the concepts well, it shouldn't be a problem!

First of all, her lecture slides are very disorganized, do NOT depend on the slides when studying for her exam, read the textbook instead. Secondly, be sure to read the instructions for the assignments clearly, she did a bad job on explaining the criteria. Her lectures are somewhat entertaining but still not helpful to my grade.
She's extremely disorganized and does not explain the instructions well for assignments. I would avoid taking her classes at all costs.

Sherrie was incredibly disorganized - to the point where it becomes an obstacle for success in her class. A half hour to an hour of live lectures are spent waiting for her to figure out zoom. Assignment instructions are vague. She was incredibly condescending to students during lectures to the point where it would merit a formal complaint.

Overall, not too bad. Took it with a heavy course load so wasn't able to put a lot of time into the class but still ended up with a solid A. Tests are worth alot, study every little detail for the textbook and lecture notes and ur good. Alot of repeat q's so some EZ marks fs. Assignments are easy if youre good at writing.
Her voice is monotonous. Her lectures are dry, and it's hard to absorb information. Tests lack information from the slides. Read the textbook if you want to get a good mark.

Her psyc100 class was not too difficult, however, there was a glitch with two of my online exams which gave me less time then I was supposed to get. She didn't seem to care and just shrugged it off. It was pretty annoying and frustrating.

Sherrie was very disorganized and the midterms were not clear, TA was no help either. She pulls questions regarding minuscule details making it difficult to do well. I did not enjoy her class at all, do NOT recommend.

I WOULD NOT TAKE PSYCH 100, I took this class for fun and thought it would be really interesting, yet I surprised on how disorganized the prof was and confusing. You can spend weeks studying lecture notes + textbook, and still do terrible on the exams. The exams are quite difficult and half of what it is on it, does not relate to the notes!

Lectures are non-important, the biggest focus of the course is memorizing textbook chapters. That being said, the assignments are easy marks and the exams are all multiple choice. Attendance for the lectures is not necessary and a grade well above passing can be achieved simply by reading the chapters and preparing for exams that way.

Confusing, ridiculously hard and random assignments. Sooo many exams that include topics not covered in class. Ridiculously hard class for an intro class. Prof goes off topic and just ends up making lectures confusing. Canvas page is also a mess.
She is a great professor. It's fun to be in her classes.

There is no final exam in her class. Instead, we were quized on every 2 chapters, which made it easier to score good grades. Her lectures are pretty good. She adds videos and personal stories to help us remember. The best thing about her class is that you can always ask her questions. Even minutes before the exam. However,she mixes up key names smt
I love this prof; she genuinely cares about her students doing well and her lectures are entertaining and informative

Didnt reply to my emails about the big project. Looked at me quite unkindly when I would go up to hand in my exams (for some reason?) Lectures were boring and questions on the exam were too specific and sometimes repeated. Overall, bad teacher and would never take a class with her again.

I toom Psych 100 and 102 with Sherri. I ended with A- with in Psych 102 but a C in Psych 100. Sherri is the best prof to take these intro psych courses with because you are guaranteed a good mark if you can just memorize the powerpoint/chapters. I love how she teaches 2 chapters and does a midterm. 4 midterms and lowest one is dropped. good deal.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. She is rude and lazy when it comes to helping her students. Going to her office hours is a joke because she doesn't want to help you and just tells you to read the textbook (even if you did and are going to her because you don't understand). If you're going to take this course, might as well take it online.
slides are very unorganized and messy. she doesn't explain a lot in the class but tests are pretty tough from details in the book.

Possible to pass the class by just reading the textbook, but attending lectures are useful because she often tells you what to focus on for exams and gives out hints as to what the long answer questions will be on. She 's easy to listen to, and makes psychology fairly interesting
Lectures are spent by her reading off of power points that she puts on canvas for you before hand.... tests are difficult but mainly out of textbook

Loved Sherri, she was hilarious. Super easy professor with a clear grading scheme. Make sure you attend lectures to receive hints for the upcoming midterm written question. Read the textbook and you'll be in the clear! (She does have an annoying "term" assignment that in my opinion was completely irrevelant to the course...)

She was very scattered and was very rude when I would email her specific questions. Would often end lectures an hour early and make us just learn the rest on our own despite having powerpoints on the topic (she did this for both classes I had with her). Tests were pretty easy and she would often give us what the long answer is in lecture.

I took this course as an elective.  Attending lecture is not mandatory.  There are 4 midterms, one assignment, research participation & no final exam.  Overall, I do not recommend taking this class as an elective because it is not worth all the effort you have to put in.

Lectures are very shallow and she often jumps over topics, but all details (except explicitly stated exceptions) are covered in the quizzes. Reading the textbook is absolutely essential. The class assignment is easy but graded very strictly. Quiz questions can be ambiguous. One quiz mark can be dropped but the last quiz is harder than the rest.

She is very scatter brained and unorganized. This interferes with the teaching process. It was not unusual for her to go on for up to 20 minutes just talking with students in the class about relatively unrelated topics.   Thankfully the material itself is pretty straight forward.

Very interesting and hilarious lectures but not mandatory to attend them. If you read the lecture notes and the textbook then this course is an easy pass. The iclicker tests and midterms were fairly easy and straightforward if you studied. Term assignment was also super easy but really time consuming.

Worst prof I've had in my 3 years. First, she didn't accept my assignment because I was 4 minutes late to class. Then someone stole my iclicker a few hours before class, and she literally said "too bad".  She rarely replies to emails and lectures are really dry and boring. Some of the midterms are based on videos watched in class. Otherwise, easy
Shes a good prof but what I love about her is her class structure. 4 exams and only the best 3 count. 7 iclicker quizzes and the best 6 count. Tests are very fair. I recommend taking Psyc100 with her

Maybe I'm just not the type of person for psychology. She is nice, very nice. But talks very fast in lecture. She went on to the next topic before I can fully organize what she said in my head. She puts the PPT on canvas before lecture. NO FINAL EXAM!!!!!This course is fun honestly, but I just can't do anything related to biology

One of the best profs I have had. Lectures are often shorter than the allotted time, she is hilarious and her tests cover material that we have actually learned. If she doesn't teach something in class she tells you and cuts it out of the test. Makes the lectures interesting.
Eh. Frustrating teacher. Clicker tests are the worst.

She is an amazing prof. One of the best prof I have ever had. She's fun so it makes a Saturday morning class fun to attend. So glad i took her class. Exams are very straight forward, as long as you understand the materials, you will do well. Reading the textbook for the exams are also useful. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Pretty boring, she doesnt lecture well at all (literally just reads off the lecture slides). Not really engaging with students, usually by the halfway point many students leave. Course material however isn't too difficult, keep up with the textbook and you should be fine. Lectures I would say are very optional, they don't make much of a difference

Great professor, very caring and nice. Adjusted the test grades multiple times since the class average was low and gave people free marks basically. Weekly assignments are easy, term assignment is super easy. Tests consist of 2-3 long answer written questions but are marked quite generously imo and its not that hard at all. Pre-recorded lectures

Dr S is so caring and empathizes with the difficulties of remote instruction. She uses great examples to illustrate points. She lowered the number of questions on the tests after getting our feedback for needing more time. Main issue is the grading scheme; an A-minus starts at 90%, so you'll need to work hard to get into that A-range.

Dr. Schimanski is extremely well prepared, kind and helpful. Her materials in canvas were excellent & she provided clear & detailed instructions every step of the way, for every assignment. Her lectures were fun and interesting, with photos of her dogs. She worked really hard to help the class do well. I would take any of her classes in the future!

Dr. S is a really nice prof that genuinely cares about her students and them doing well. One of the test averages was low, and she gave a bonus credit assignment to help bring the average back up. She also cares about how her students feel about the class/test difficulty and will accommodate accordingly. She is an awesome prof, highly recommend her

Professor Schimanski is such an awesome prof. She is very easy to understand and generally wants all of her students to do well. The lectures have the same material as the readings so I would suggest to mostly focus on taking lecture notes and just skimming through the textbook. She provides very good feedback. Overall, an amazing prof!

Genuinely wants all of her students to succeed and get the best mark possible. Her assignments and grading are very straightforward. Lectures were asynchronous with optional live lectures times for questions. Tests are quite difficult, but if the class average is quite low for a test she offers chances to boost your marks.

Dr. Schimanski is a great prof! You can tell she really cares about her students and does as much as she can to help everyone succeed. Her lectures are really in-depth and tests are all written and based on lectures. Would definitely take a course with her again. Very organized for it being remote right now :) 10/10 recommend!

Really cares about students well being and improvement in the class. Super accessible out of class. Had her during online season, when test questions get somewhat confusing she is quick to help clarify. The small activities she posts are beneficial to your tests. Her slides alone carried me through the course. Would join her class again.

I've taken both Psyc 100 and Psyc 201W with Dr. S and she is so caring and sweet! She's clear about what she wants you to learn and expects of you from projects and tests. She tries to incorporate dog pics/videos in her lectures to make them more interesting! Overall, a genuinely lovely person and easy to follow lectures.

Lectures were hard to follow, but she gave great examples. iClicker quizzes were really important and happened each lecture. Exams were confusing, not really based off of the lecture or textbook (material on exams didn't come from 1 source), almost like the lecture notes were based off of something different

Messy lectures. Textbook is your friend in this course. Don't even look at the lecture notes or go to one. Read the textbook and teach yourself. She cannot even finish the lecture slides nor reviews them before the exams and quizzes. Avoid.

Not a good prof, her lectures were so uninformative and unorganized. She barely had definitions, focused more on questions and examples. Didn't help for exams, so don't bother studying her lecture slides, save yourself the time and just read the textbook. Barely showed up to class or listened to lectures cause it was a waste of time.
Gary Poole is the BEST psyc prof SFU ever had!!!!
I agree, his distance ed videos are awesome!! I was laughing more than I was taking notes, and he makes things make SENSE. We should definitely have more teachers like him.
Enjoyable class, great guy.
Great Prof, We need more of them who can actually teach.
Best prof ever, period. Why did he have to leave SFU? Come back Gary!!! snif
Funny Guy
I've always wondered if we like him because he uses a mind control technique..

Russel is a really nice guy and he always plays music at the start of class which is awesome however I dont like his teaching style. You basically have to teach yourself everything and the class is very overwhelming. The TAs are really hard markers and pretty much every class you either have a quiz, writing assignment or exam.

She's an awesome prof for first year psyc. She's engaging, speaks the material clearly and makes you feel comfortable approaching her about the content. Fair exams and asks fair things in her projects and papers. Good prof
Very good professor.The exams are very fair and quite easy if you read the textbook.She's nice and helpful in her office hours as well.
Terrible Proff. She must not have much experience considering she can't answer any questions we asked her. Reads right off of powerpoint. Tests were too hard compared to her lame lectures.
HORRIFIC PROF!!!! I WANNA DIE AS SOON AS I STEP INTO ONE OF HER LECTURES. YOU CAN HEAR HALF THE CLASS SNORING BECAUSE SHE WILL PUT YOU TO SLEEP!!!!
Went out of her way to help. Would spend hours, emailing and meeting with you to be sure that you understood everything.
Helpful, clear, and friendly. :)
